intro: Trichodesma zeylanicum subsp. euzeylanicum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf trichodesma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite and have a glossy surface, while the flowers are usually white or pale yellow. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or saline soils.
